SENT.plain: The authors report their experience with regional anaesthesia in carotid surgery
They performed 80 carotid endarterectomies in 79 patients
Thirty-three patients were at high surgical risk because of contralateral internal carotid artery occlusion or bilateral stenosis (greater than 70%) or ischemic brain areas for past stroke
In this high risk group 4 strokes were registered in the postoperative period, while no strokes appeared in patients non at risk
